page.title: 15HOUSES AROUND HIGHAM FERRERS
page.content:
The houses in this are vary in age from the 16th century to the 20th century.
The majority of the older houses are situated in the heart of the town, along College Street and the Market Square. Many of these houses are listed buildings, including Grade 2 category and cannot be altered without permission the Department of the Environment. These mellow limestone houses give an old world appearance to the main part of the town.
Behind this old facade exists modern housing estates of detached and semi- detached houses including some inter- war Council houses.
